availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: McCracken County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Edward Bradshaw and Francis Summers. Married to Marianne Rumseyin in Christian County, Kentucky, on May 31, 1832. Father of Edward R. Bradshaw and William F. Bradshaw. Farmer in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned 9 enslaved persons in Christian County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in McCracken, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed Denys Haley as a day laborer in McCracken County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned 4 enslaved persons in McCracken County, Kentucky, in 1860.
